trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when a specified timeout has expired.
The TimeoutException class can specify a message to describe the source of the exception.
When a method throws this exception, the message is usually "The timeout provided has expired and the operation has not been completed."
This class is used, for example, by the <xref:System.ServiceProcess.ServiceController> class's <xref:System.ServiceProcess.ServiceController.WaitForStatus%2A> member.
The operation that can throw the exception is a change of the service's <xref:System.ServiceProcess.ServiceController.Status%2A> property (for example, from `Paused` to `ContinuePending`).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceProcess.TimeoutException"></xref> class with no message text.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceProcess.TimeoutException"></xref> class with the specified message text.
Text that describes the type or source of the exception.
Initializes a new instace of the <xref href="System.ServiceProcess.TimeoutException"></xref> class with the specified serialization information and context.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext> that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
The info parameter is .
The class name is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> or <xref:System.Exception.HResult*> is zero (0).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceProcess.TimeoutException"></xref> class with the specified message text and inner exception.
Text that describes the type or source of the exception.
The exception that caused the current exception.
